TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TarEntry extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the core behavior of a tar entry from an archive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
All the properties exposed by this class are supported by the <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryFormat.V7>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryFormat.Ustar>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryFormat.Pax>, and <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryFormat.Gnu> formats.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Checksum As Integer
public: property int Checksum { int get(); };

Docs.summary: The checksum of all the fields in this entry. The value is non-zero either when the entry is read from an existing archive, or after the entry is written to a new archive.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.DataStream : System.IO.Stream with get, set
public: property System::IO::Stream ^ DataStream { System::IO::Stream ^ get(); void set(System::IO::Stream ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data section of this entry. If the does not support containing data, then returns .

value.para: Gets a stream that represents the data section of this entry.

Sets a new stream that represents the data section, if it makes sense for the to contain data. If a stream already exists, the old stream is disposed before substituting it with the new stream. Setting a stream is allowed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If you write data to this data stream, make sure to rewind it to the desired start position before writing this entry into an archive using <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarWriter.WriteEntry(System.Formats.Tar.TarEntry)>.

Docs.exception: Setting a data section is not supported because the is not (or for an archive of format).

Cannot set an unreadable stream.
-or-
An I/O problem occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property EntryType As TarEntryType
public: property System::Formats::Tar::TarEntryType EntryType { System::Formats::Tar::TarEntryType get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the type of filesystem object represented by this entry.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ExtractToFile (string destinationFileName, bool overwrite);
.method public hidebysig instance void ExtractToFile(string destinationFileName, bool overwrite) cil managed
Public Sub ExtractToFile (destinationFileName As String, overwrite As Boolean)
public: void ExtractToFile(System::String ^ destinationFileName, bool overwrite);

Docs.param: The path to the destination file.
if this method should overwrite any existing filesystem object located in the path; to prevent overwriting.
Docs.summary: Extracts the current file or directory to the filesystem. Symbolic links and hard links are not extracted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Files of type <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.BlockDevice>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.CharacterDevice> or <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.Fifo> can only be extracted in Unix platforms.
Elevation is required to extract a <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.BlockDevice> or <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.CharacterDevice> to disk.
Symbolic links can be recreated using <xref:System.IO.File.CreateSymbolicLink(System.String,System.String)>, <xref:System.IO.Directory.CreateSymbolicLink(System.String,System.String)> or <xref:System.IO.FileSystemInfo.CreateAsSymbolicLink(System.String)>.
Hard links can only be extracted when using <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarFile.ExtractToDirectory(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Boolean)> or <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarFile.ExtractToDirectory(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)>.

Docs.exception:
The parent directory of does not exist.
-or-
is and a file already exists in .
-or-
A directory exists with the same name as .
-or-
An I/O problem occurred.
Attempted to extract a symbolic link, a hard link, or an unsupported entry type.
Operation not permitted due to insufficient permissions.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Format As TarEntryFormat
public: property System::Formats::Tar::TarEntryFormat Format { System::Formats::Tar::TarEntryFormat get(); };
member this.Gid : int with get, set
public: property int Gid { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the group that owns the file represented by this entry.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This field is only supported in Unix platforms.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Length As Long
public: property long Length { long get(); };

Docs.summary: When the indicates an entry that can contain data, gets the length in bytes of such data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The entry type that commonly contains data is <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.RegularFile> (or <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.V7RegularFile> in the <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryFormat.V7> format). Other uncommon entry types that can also contain data are: <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.ContiguousFile>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.DirectoryList>, <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.MultiVolume> and <xref:System.Formats.Tar.TarEntryType.SparseFile>.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.LinkName : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ LinkName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: When the indicates a or a , gets or sets the link target path of the link.
Docs.exception: The entry type is not or .

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Mode : System.Formats.Tar.TarFileMode with get, set
public: property System::Formats::Tar::TarFileMode Mode { System::Formats::Tar::TarFileMode get(); void set(System::Formats::Tar::TarFileMode value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Unix file permissions of the file represented by this entry.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The value in this field has no effect on Windows platforms.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ModificationTime : DateTimeOffset with get, set
public: property DateTimeOffset ModificationTime { DateTimeOffset get(); void set(DateTimeOffset value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the last time the contents of the file represented by this entry were modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
In Unix platforms, this timestamp is commonly known as `mtime`.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Name : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the entry, which includes the relative path and the filename.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToString () As String

Docs.summary: Returns a string that represents the current entry.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Uid : int with get, set
public: property int Uid { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the user that owns the file represented by this entry.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This field is only supported in Unix platforms.
